column4: Can anyone direct me to a good tutorial on how to set up a wireless router on ubuntu?
do you mean connect to a wireless network? or configure a wireless router. cuz second option is same as anything else: connect to the router through your browser.
configure the network adapter, i downloaded drivers for windows and for linux, and i just cant get it to work
do you know what type of wireless adapter it is?
wusb54gc ver3
by linksys
if you run ifconfig do you see the device?
Im not sure how i would know that (noob to linux world), but there is nothing that seems to look like it
if you type ifconfig in terminal (applications > accessories > terminal), you should see either a eth1 or wlan0, something like that...
i see Link encap:Ethernet and before that i see eth0
what if you try 'lspci | grep -e Linksys' ?
online forums are saying that version three requires custom compilation and module loading, but i'm still looking for details, k?

okay, i tried looking, and i found some that said use ndsiwrapper, some that said to download something from ralink and change it, but i could never find the data to change, ive been trying to two days
i totally sympathize, i spent several days working on cobbling together a decent conexant driver for karmic w/o having to pay linuxant for the unlocked driver. :)
I entered that command, and nothing showed up, but i got no erroor

that could mean that it's not seeing it at all or not seeing it as Linksys; if you search through the output from 'lspci', is there anything that looks like it? you may also try unplugging it then plugging it back in, then checking dmesg
My ethernet port shows up, event though its not connected to web, but my wereless doesnt seem to show up in the list of USB controllers
dammit i'm an idiot, i'm sorry; i'm used to doing this for internal ports, can you try lsusb instead of lspci?
I get my SanDisk memory stick, and then the device below that the ID has 1727:0077 but no title

odd... sadly i've reached the end of the road for my evening. as a last piece of advice, since this seems to be a common problem, all the super-techs jump on this type of thing on launchpad. your specific problem is here: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/446889
good luck to you!
thanks alot for the help, ill keep working on it
